host or slot binding
Set, PE or env
Number of units to bind to

attributes.name: new_unit
attributes.summary: Unit type that should be bound

description.line: Defines if threads, cores, sockets ... should be bound

attributes.name: new_filter
attributes.summary: Mask that defines which parts of a topology should not be bound

description.line: Masked parts have to be lowercase in the topology string.
Defines how units within the topology string should be sorted before binding.
Defines the start position for binding within the topology string.
Defines the end position for binding within the topology string.
Defines the strategy for binding, like linear, striding, packed or explicit
... like linear, striding or explicit
set, PE or env
Amount of CPU cores to bind
Logical socket ID to bind to, starting with 0

attributes.name: parameter_core_offset
attributes.summary: logical core ID of specified socket

description.line: Logical core ID of specified socket to bind to, starting with 0
Defines the striding's step size, starting with 1. Not used for other strategies.
used for explicit binding, a list of logical socket/core pairs

attributes.name: specific_hostname
attributes.summary: hostname of a host where the other specific attributes are valid for

description.line: Used in scheduler only to identify where a specific binding decision was done for.

attributes.name: specific_binding
attributes.summary: A specific binding decision for a task or job on a host

description.line: Used in scheduler only to hold a binding decision for a specific task or job on a host.

attributes.name: specific_binding_list
attributes.summary: Sublist of individual task specific bindings.

description.line: Id of sublist specifies a task ID and the string the binding done for that task.
Exists only if task specific binding decisions have to be done.
Placeholder which can be used for arbitrary data.
Its purpose is to be able to add new attributes without changing the spooling format.
It is a list of arbitrary type and it is spooled.
